meanings.definition: To make someone very drunk or infatuated.
meanings.sent1: The strong cocktail began to besot him after just a few sips.
meanings.sent2: She was besotted with the charming stranger she met at the party.
meanings.sent3: The love potion accidentally besotted the wrong person, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The music had a magical quality that seemed to besot all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotic dance moves seemed to besot the entire audience.

meanings.definition: To become infatuated or obsessed with someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He started to besot her with his constant compliments and attention.
meanings.sent2: The young girl quickly besotted over the new puppy in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The quirky character in the book besotted readers with his unique charm.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was besotted with thoughts of the upcoming vacation.
meanings.sent5: The delicious aroma of freshly baked cookies besotted the entire household.
